meanings.definition: To perform an action or behavior before it actually occurs.
meanings.sent1: She preenacts her speech in front of the mirror before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The actor preenacts his lines to ensure a flawless performance on stage.
meanings.sent3: He preenacts his dance moves in the living room, pretending to be a famous performer.
meanings.sent4: The athlete preenacts scoring the winning goal in his mind before every match.
meanings.sent5: The student preenacts answering exam questions to reduce anxiety during tests.

meanings.definition: To act out or simulate a future event.
meanings.sent1: The children preenacts a tea party with their stuffed animals in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The pilot preenacts emergency procedures in a flight simulator to be prepared for any situation.
meanings.sent3: She preenacts a conversation with her crush, imagining different responses and reactions.
meanings.sent4: The chef preenacts plating a new dish in his mind before actually preparing it in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The scientist preenacts the experiment to identify any potential issues before conducting it.

meanings.definition: To anticipate and prepare for a future situation.
meanings.sent1: The team preenacts their strategy for the upcoming match to ensure a victory.
meanings.sent2: The hiker preenacts packing the essentials for the trek to avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent3: He preenacts his apology to his friend, trying to find the right words to mend their relationship.
meanings.sent4: The farmer preenacts the harvest season, making plans for crop rotation and irrigation.
meanings.sent5: The manager preenacts the staff meeting, considering different scenarios and outcomes.
